articles.description: Health officials have confirmed Oregon’s first case of pediatric multi-system inflammatory syndrome in a 14-year-old girl.
articles.content:
PORTLAND, Ore. (KOIN) Health officials have confirmed Oregons first case of pediatric multi-system inflammatory syndrome in a 14-year-old girl. 
The condition (also known as PIMS) is rare and not much is known about it but its thought to be associated with C… [+1631 chars]

articles.title: An outbreak at a choir practice hints at how coronavirus spreads - Salon
articles.description: "The act of singing itself might have contributed to SARS-CoV-2 transmission," the CDC says of a choir practice outbreak

articles.title: Royal Australian Air Force unveils unmanned Boeing aircraft - Yahoo Lifestyle
articles.description: It is a major milestone for Boeing as well as Australia — which hasn't built an aircraft start-to-finish in 50 years.
articles.content:
The Royal Australian Air Force and Boeing Australia unveiled the first military aircraft designed in Australia in over 50 years.

articles.title: Oregon COVID-19 death toll hits 134, OHA reports 3,338 cases statewide - KATU

articles.title: 108-year-old man may be the oldest survivor of COVID-19 - KCRA Sacramento
articles.description: “I didn’t even know I had it. … I guess if I knew I had it I might have been scared.”
articles.content:
At 108, Phil Corio is certainly one of the oldest people in New Mexico and the U.S.
But now the Los Ranchos resident has a new claim to fame: he just might be the oldest person in the world to survive COVID-19.
